body:
I tried adding the line proposed but it doesn't solve my issue.

I'll wait for your feedback

I would probably generally advise against manually loading tables inside your tables. If the tables are related, then you could/should use associations, and if they're not related, then they probably shouldn't be a dependency. But that's programming principles, and even if discouraged, it ideally shouldn't break code.

I guess things would work when reflection would do `$this->getTableLocator()->clear();` instead of just removing the one fetched alias? Not sure though how I'd feel about doing that, and what side effects it could possibly have.

It's mostly to send emails through events without using a global event manager.

I tend to want to change and forget about using event, as it doesn't make code easily readable.

However, I don't feel that the fixture creation should force me to change my code either.

> By doing so it triggers an exception because EmailsTable is already created by loading UsersTable.

Do you have an error message and stack trace for this error, or a small code sample to help reproduce this problem?

I explained in the beginning how to reproduce.

The error message is only that it can't create my EmailTable as it's already in registry.

Let me know if I can help anymore

@markstory As I understand it, the flow is as follows:

1. Test fixture fetches table `A` for reflection.
2. In `A::initialize()` table `B` is manually loaded via the table locator.
3. Test fixture removes `A` from locator.
4. Test fixture fetches table `B` for reflection.
5. Error is triggered because `B` has already been loaded in step 2 and therefore cannot be reconfigured.

> I explained in the beginning how to reproduce.

Vaguely yes, I was hoping to get an error message and stack trace so I could look at where the error is coming from and what you're seeing. I'll try and blunder my way through it instead.

I ll send it over on Monday. 
it all starts with the TestFixture:init() where it passes in $this->_schemaFromReflection();
I'm not able to reproduce this issue. I'm not able to put anymore time into this without a way to reproduce.

Hi,

Sorry for the delay.

Here is the error log :
```
RuntimeException : You cannot configure "Emails", it already exists in the registry.
 C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\Datasource\Locator\AbstractLocator.php:57
 C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\ORM\Locator\TableLocator.php:205
 C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\ORM\Locator\LocatorAwareTrait.php:90
 C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\TestSuite\Fixture\TestFixture.php:250
 C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\TestSuite\Fixture\TestFixture.php:155
 C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\tests\Fixture\EmailsFixture.php:29
 C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\TestSuite\Fixture\TestFixture.php:115
 C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\TestSuite\Fixture\FixtureHelper.php:94
 C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\TestSuite\Fixture\TruncateStrategy.php:51
 C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\TestSuite\TestCase.php:301
 C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\TestSuite\TestCase.php:249
 C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\tests\TestCase\IntegrationTests\UsersIntegrationTest.php:46
```
You need a User fixture with only an init() function, same for emails.
Emails fixture must be called after Users fixture.

This works, 
```
 public $fixtures = [
        'app.Emails',
        'app.Users',
    ];
```
but this does not
```
public $fixtures = [
        'app.Users',
        'app.Emails',
    ];
```

Users and Emails are connected like this :

In UsersTable : `$this->hasMany('Emails');`
In EmailsTable: `$this->belongsTo('Users');`

In UserTable:initialize() you need to call `$emailsTable = TableRegistry::getTableLocator()->get('Emails');`

Because they are connected as associations and that I need the table in the UsersTable::intialize(), the table is created twice and causes the exception.

After checking again, if in UsersTable::initialize() I do : `$emailsTable = $this->Emails` instead, it works.

But in my opinion, it should work in both cases.

I realize that I have the same problem with I18n tables.

I18n tables are named in my case services_i18n, so when I load the fixture, it wants to find a services_i18ns table. So I need to add a table property in the fixture. But doing so, generates an error :
```
RuntimeException : You cannot configure "CategoriesI18n", it already exists in the registry.
 C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\Datasource\Locator\AbstractLocator.php:57
 C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\ORM\Locator\TableLocator.php:205
 C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\ORM\Locator\LocatorAwareTrait.php:90
 C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\TestSuite\Fixture\TestFixture.php:250
 C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\TestSuite\Fixture\TestFixture.php:155
 C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\tests\Fixture\CategoriesI18nFixture.php:31
 C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\TestSuite\Fixture\TestFixture.php:115
 C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\TestSuite\Fixture\FixtureHelper.php:94
 C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\TestSuite\Fixture\TruncateStrategy.php:51
 C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\TestSuite\TestCase.php:301
 C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\TestSuite\TestCase.php:249
 C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\tests\TestCase\IntegrationTests\BookingsIntegrationTest.php:83
```
of course, I could have named it differently but it has never been a problem until now.

issue.title: Clear TableRegistry after reflecting schema in fixtures

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
User-land code can use TableRegistry in Table::initialize() hooks We need to clear the table registry to resolve errors caused by differing configuration.

Fixes #16373

issue.title: Pipelines

repository.name: cakephp-test-suite-light
repository.description: A fast test suite for CakePHP applications

issue.body:
Hi,

I use Cakephp 4.2.10 and "vierge-noire/cakephp-fixture-factories": "2.5"

I am using Bibucket pipelines with docker images to perform tests.

When I want to do my tests using a docker image for the database, it does not work with the php unit listeners of CakephpTestSuiteLight.

I get this :
```
Exception: Unable to insert fixture "App\Test\Fixture\UsersFixture" in "App\Test\TestCase\IntegrationTests\BookingsIntegrationTest" test case: 
SQLSTATE[42S02]: Base table or view not found: 1146 Table 'mcube27_jmstest.users' doesn't exist
In [C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\vierge-noire\cakephp-test-suite-light\src\FixtureManager.php, line 181]
```

And I get this cli_error message :
```
Caused by: [PDOException] SQLSTATE[42S02]: Base table or view not found: 1146 Table 'mcube27_jmstest.users' doesn't exist in C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\Database\Statement\MysqlStatement.php on line 39
Stack Trace:
- C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\Database\Statement\MysqlStatement.php:39
- C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\Database\Connection.php:337
- C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\Core\Retry\CommandRetry.php:70
- C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\Database\Connection.php:340
- C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\Database\Query.php:250
- C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\TestSuite\Fixture\TestFixture.php:344
- C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\vierge-noire\cakephp-test-suite-light\src\FixtureManager.php:173
- C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\Database\Connection.php:723
- C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\Core\Retry\CommandRetry.php:70
- C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\Database\Connection.php:729
- C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\vierge-noire\cakephp-test-suite-light\src\FixtureManager.php:184
- C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\Database\Connection.php:682
- C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\vierge-noire\cakephp-test-suite-light\src\FixtureManager.php:185
- C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\cakephp\cakephp\src\TestSuite\Fixture\FixtureInjector.php:101
- C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\vierge-noire\cakephp-test-suite-light\src\FixtureInjector.php:75
- C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\phpunit\phpunit\src\Framework\TestResult.php:424
- C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\phpunit\phpunit\src\Framework\TestResult.php:644
- C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\phpunit\phpunit\src\Framework\TestCase.php:838
- C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\phpunit\phpunit\src\Framework\TestSuite.php:626
- C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\phpunit\phpunit\src\Framework\TestSuite.php:626
- C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\phpunit\phpunit\src\TextUI\TestRunner.php:656
- C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\phpunit\phpunit\src\TextUI\Command.php:235
- C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\phpunit\phpunit\src\TextUI\Command.php:194
- C:\webserver\www\weeezy-api\vendor\phpunit\phpunit\phpunit:98
```

But it works if I reverse back to cakephp normal listener.

I ran it on my computer with docker using this to start the database server
`docker run --name mariadblatest --env MARIADB_ROOT_PASSWORD=secret --env MARIADB_USER=dev --env MARIADB_DATABASE=test --env MARIADB_PASSWORD=test -p 3306:3306 mariadb:latest`

I have been searching for 2 hours but I do not understand. Maybe the triggers are not set on the database ?

Thank you very much !
